summary: Demand for commercial space launches is expected to increase. Twelve launch sites held operator licenses in Aug. 2020, and 11 more were seeking licenses from the Federal Aviation Administration. Congress asked the FAA to recommend ways to facilitate and promote investments in space transportation infrastructure. The FAA told us that its response would focus on 2 existing FAA grant programs. But we recommended that the...
title: Commercial Space Transportation: FAA Should Examine a Range of Options to Support U.S. Launch Infrastructure
